lead_paragraph: The four were arrested last November in a crackdown by the hard-line judiciary, and the convictions were seen as a warning to all Iranian journalists.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

headline.print_headline: Iran Gives 4 Journalists Long Prison Terms
headline.main: Iranian Court Sentences 4 Journalists to Long Prison Terms

snippet: The four were arrested last November in a crackdown by the hard-line judiciary, and the convictions were seen as a warning to all Iranian journalists.
abstract: Iranian revolutionary court sentences four journalists supportive of Pres Hassan Rouhani to long prison terms; four were arrested in November on charges of acting against national security by helping United States 'infiltrate' country; arrests reflect rivalry between Rouhani's government and hard liners determined to restrict journalists.
